channel.title: Firefox 4
channel.description: Anyone installed it yet? I did, and the new look is going to take some getting used to, but I like how the menu bar no longer takes up as much space.

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

The most I have ever seen it at was 150k. Rather than performance over the two browsers I prefer the “look” of ff > chrome.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Hmm… seems to use a lot of memory. Starts off fine (~100,000K) but then gets bigger as browsing continues (had it at 900000K before). Closing tabs doesn’t help.
Has this always occurred with ff?

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

FF vs Chrome thread.

FF for me. Been happy with it since I discovered it.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @kando2 kando2
item.description:
@kando2 wrote:

chrome is the way to go.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

I had been using FF4 Beta and switched to Chrome and I haven’t run into any major problems. I am just not a fan of how Chrome handles history compared to FF.

Also Chrome opens faster than FF4 does even if I clicked FF first which is a ++.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

SETO:

haters, all you loved firefox when you hated IE, now u love chrome and hate FF

I’ve always loved firefox (except for one revision, 2.5 maybe?) and I still do. I’ve also tried to use chrome quite a bit now that it has plugin and extension support, but I still don’t like it as well as firefox.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

SETO:

haters, all you loved firefox when you hated IE, now u love chrome and hate FF

I always hated FF. It was just the lesser of two evils.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:52, topic:387885”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=483679.msg3549048#msg3549048 date=1301370933]
Boot up time, not page load time. But that still seems a bit extreme…
[/quote]

[quote]We opened five Web sites for all tests, in addition to any test site. These were: talkingpointsmemo.com, aol.com, youtube.com, newyorktimes.com, giantbomb.com, cnettv.cnet.com.
The boot time benchmarks were conducted by manually starting a stopwatch when clicking on the browser’s taskbar icon, and then hitting stop when the last tab’s resolving indicator stopped rotating.[/quote][/quote]Bad name then, I would have used ‘page load time’ But I guess those sites have a lot of stuff on them, I just did talkingpointsmemo and it took 7 seconds… might have just been their connection?

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Davidi2:

Boot up time, not page load time. But that still seems a bit extreme…

We opened five Web sites for all tests, in addition to any test site. These were: talkingpointsmemo.com, aol.com, youtube.com, newyorktimes.com, giantbomb.com, cnettv.cnet.com. The boot time benchmarks were conducted by manually starting a stopwatch when clicking on the browser's taskbar icon, and then hitting stop when the last tab's resolving indicator stopped rotating.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“SETO, post:50, topic:387885”]haters, all you loved firefox when you hated IE, now u love chrome and hate FF[/quote]Actually we are saying we hate chrome and love FF

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:47, topic:387885”][quote author=Newty link=topic=483679.msg3549004#msg3549004 date=1301367924]

currently using FF and Chrome. I swapped to chrome because I thought I could get away from errors, however I seem to have more problems with Chrome than I do FF, Welcome back.

I find that browsing the Internet on Chrome on Windows Vista (at my dads house) is full of errors. Plugins like Java and Flash constantly crash and the browser freezes up intermittently.
[/quote]
Ditto, shockwave and google gears always crashed for me, on mac and w7 :([/quote]

Oh yeah I forgot about google gears, its always crashing

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:47, topic:387885”][quote author=Newty link=topic=483679.msg3549004#msg3549004 date=1301367924]

currently using FF and Chrome. I swapped to chrome because I thought I could get away from errors, however I seem to have more problems with Chrome than I do FF, Welcome back.

I find that browsing the Internet on Chrome on Windows Vista (at my dads house) is full of errors. Plugins like Java and Flash constantly crash and the browser freezes up intermittently.
[/quote]
Ditto, shockwave and google gears always crashed for me, on mac and w7 :([/quote]Can confirm, and some times it would really mess up my right clicking on certain extensions (the right click menu bar would randomly dissapear)

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:44, topic:387885”]Chrome 10/Internet Explorer 9/Firefox 4
Boot time (s) 26.22 21.86 17.80

What the fuck? Since when does chrome take 26 seconds to open and load a page? I don’t think even firefox takes 17 seconds to do that…[/quote]Boot up time, not page load time. But that still seems a bit extreme…

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Ollie:

currently using FF and Chrome. I swapped to chrome because I thought I could get away from errors, however I seem to have more problems with Chrome than I do FF, Welcome back.

I find that browsing the Internet on Chrome on Windows Vista (at my dads house) is full of errors. Plugins like Java and Flash constantly crash and the browser freezes up intermittently.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Chrome 10/Internet Explorer 9/Firefox 4
Boot time (s) 26.22 21.86 17.80

What the fuck? Since when does chrome take 26 seconds to open and load a page? I don’t think even firefox takes 17 seconds to do that…

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

currently using FF and Chrome. I swapped to chrome because I thought I could get away from errors, however I seem to have more problems with Chrome than I do FF, Welcome back.

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“thepinksock, post:37, topic:387885”][quote author=Niall link=topic=483679.msg3548116#msg3548116 date=1301324369]
go to options then advanced and check use auto scrolling
[/quote]
Why isn’t this on by default… :|[/quote]

not a clue, it has never been enabled by default in linux for me but the opposite is true on windows

but then with linux there’s the whole middle mouse wheel paste which is nice but only needs to be used where the user can actually enter text

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Rendering web pages is something that the four main browsers (Chrome, Safari, Firefox and IE9) all do fast enough now. They’re all at a point where i’m comfortable using them all as far as how fast they load up and handle web pages.

The differentiation comes from usability and little extra features.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Shame benchmarks don’t show up things like “when you open a new tab in FF4 sometimes the entire UI freezes for 5 seconds”

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @SpeedIsMeh SpeedIsMeh
item.description:
@SpeedIsMeh wrote:

Download.com

Benchmark battle: Chrome vs. IE vs. Firefox

There's no doubt that the latest crop of stable browsers from Google, Microsoft, and Mozilla are the best they've ever produced. But how do they perform when tested under identical conditions?

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It is officially released now, and I’m using it soley, having no problems at all. (besides that a handful of my extensions aren’t updated to work with 4 yet, but nothing absolutely needed.)
